task_summary: Detect the white plate, grasp it from above, move above the red plate, lower until contact, release, and retreat.

task_long_description.overview: A tabletop xArm manipulator must relocate a white plate onto a red plate. The scene shows a green workspace with a shallow white plate near center-right and a red plate at the lower-left. The robot should approach the white plate, align precisely, compute a top grasp, pick it, transfer it toward the red plateâ€™s area, descend until contact, open the gripper to place, and then retreat to a safe pose. Motions should be deliberate to avoid tipping the plate.
preconditions: Gripper operational and empty at start
Perception can localize white_plate and red_plate
stepwise_plan: Move above and align to white_plate; compute a top grasp
Detect red_plate and move above it
Lower until contact and release plate
success_criteria: White plate ends resting stably on red plate
No collision with table or robot base
Object released and gripper empty at end
failure_and_recovery: If white_plate not detected, retry perception sweep
If grasp slips, re-open, re-align, and regrasp
If contact not detected when placing, increase depth slightly and retry
task_long_description.termination: Terminate when the plate is released above the red plate area and the arm retreats to a safe pose.

frame_3.now_evidence: Gripper is aligned near the rim of the white plate, consistent with imminent grasp.
frame_3.predicts_next: Robot will close or execute a pick motion and lift.

task_instruction: Pick up a white plate, and then place it on the red plate.

node_specs.description: Move above target with vertical clearance.
Compute grasp pose and store on blackboard.
Localize the red plate for placement.
Descend until contact sensed for placing.
Back away to a safe pose.

failure_modes: White plate not detected or partially occluded
Premature release before contact on red plate
recovery_strategy: Re-run DetectObject with a wider search
Reattempt pick with same top strategy
If no contact sensed, lower slightly and retry release
assumptions: Frames show a shallow white plate and a red plate; instruction matches visuals.
Top grasp is feasible given the plate rim and gripper geometry.
Red plate position is at lower-left as seen; placement uses contact sensing rather than a precise pose.

expected_success_criteria: White plate rests stably on the red plate after release
Gripper is empty and robot retreats without collision
